channel.title: Help with SendKeys and KeyDown!
channel.description: For some reason, I cant put "KeyDown" in my scripts or I get an Unknown Identifier error. Does anybody know what the problem is and can somebody help me so I can finish my script?!?

item.title: Help with SendKeys and KeyDown!
item.dc:creator: @driger1592 driger1592
item.description:
@driger1592 wrote:

KeyDown(32);
Wait(25+random(25));
KeyUp(32);

That should do the trick. Let us see the script with this part added in if it gives you another error.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with SendKeys and KeyDown!
item.dc:creator: @413X 413X
item.description:
@413X wrote:

Im trying to get it to simulate hitting the “spacebar” button once on line 9. Could anybody tell me what should go in there. I can’t seem to use the KeyDown command. I know you put the number in and everything but SCAR isn’t recognizing it as a proper command.

program button;
var x,y:integer;
begin
repeat
wait(1);
until(FindColorTolerance(x,y,39168,317, 189,343, 299, 20));
begin

end;
end.[br][size=1]Posted at: May 28, 2006, 08:41:37 am[/size][hr]Somebody help please!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Help with SendKeys and KeyDown!
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

I dun really know what u’re trying to do, but:
KeyDown is a command that press a key, it needs to be used with ascii codes, http://www.lookuptables.com/.
For example:
KeyDown(13);
will press the enter/return key.
If you need to check if a key is down:

function IsFunctionKeyDown(Key: Byte): Boolean; - Checks if the given function key is down. Meanings of Key: 0: SHIFT 1: CONTROL 2: ALT 3: LEFT SHIFT 4: LEFT CONTROL 5: LEFT ALT 6: RIGHT SHIFT 7: RIGHT CONTROL 8: RIGHT ALT

function IsFKeyDown(Num: Byte): Boolean; - Num = 1…12. Checks if F1, F2, … F11 or F12 key is down corresponding to Num.

function IsArrowDown(Num: Byte): Boolean; - Checks if arrow key is down. Num corresponds to 0 = up, 1 = right, 2 = down, 3 = left.

function IsKeyDown(C: Char): Boolean; - Checks if the given key is down.
Example:
if(IsKeyDown(‘a’))then
Writeln(‘You have pressed “a”. Congratulations!’);

If you just want to send s sentence, SendKeys(‘Sentence here’ + Chr(13));

Read full topic
